title: FirstCare seeks one-stop maternity center

text: FirstCare seeks one-stop maternity centerEaster season brunches in Palm Beach: Time to hop to it and make a reservationNews Entertainment Society Arts Real Estate News Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals  LIFESTYLEFirstCare seeks one-stop maternity centerShannon Donnellysdonnelly@pbdailynews.comFriends and supporters a faith-based maternity center gathered to launch plans for a centralized comprehensive program of care for women in Palm Beach County.More Palm Beach society news here.The ’’Vision Dinner’’ to benefit First Care Women’s Clinic took place Feb.8 at The Breakers.Angela Williams, Allie Hanley, Luciana Vittoria, Annie Erneston, Denice Simpson, Diane Hanlon and Holly Boswell were chairwomen for the evening, which spotlighted the 20/20 Vision and Beyond: Project Light and Hope campaign.Beau Heyman, executive director of First Care, spoke about the agency, which assists women who are dealing with crisis pregnancies.The faith-based organization focuses on providing women with alternatives and resources to keep their child, rather than seek termination.Boswell, who has served on the board for 11 years, became involved with First Care Women’s Clinic because she believes in the pro-life movement.“I believe we can help the mothers through whatever they are dealing with – either through adoption, parenting classes or more support,” Boswell said.“I think the pro-life movement gets accused of caring only about the babies, but First Care cares very much about the mother, her well-being and what happens to her.”The capital campaign’s goal is to fund a comprehensive care center, Heyman said.“We’d like to purchase a building, which would house a First Care medical clinic and partners, such as social services and a pro-life obstetrician, as tenants,” Heyman said.“It would enable us to refer clients to existing partners, and be a centralized location for services. Such a center doesn’t exist in Palm Beach County now, and we feel that it would fill a critical void.”More than 60 people attended the dinner.Proceeds benefit First Care Women’s Clinic, which was founded in 1983 to provide compassionate care, including reproductive health screenings, testing and ultrasounds, to its clients from offices in West Palm Beach, Lake Worth, Boca Raton and the western communities.Careers Staff Directory Accessibility Site Map Legals Public notice certification Our Ethical Principles Responsible Disclosure Terms of Service Privacy Policy Your Privacy ChoicesContact Us Support Local Business Advertise Your Business Advertising Terms and Conditions Buy and Sell Promote Your Event Licensing & Reprints Help Center Subscriber Guide Manage Account Give FeedbackNewsletters Facebook X eNewspaper Archives InstagramJobs Cars Classifieds Reviewed.com 10Best LocaliQ Digital Marketing Solutions Events© 2024 www.palmbeachdailynews.com.
